contextId.information: It is implied that "many" refers to people. AT: "many people talking about me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The word "save" is implied. AT: "save my life from the lions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This refers to the good news that God rescues his people. AT: "good news that because you are righteous, you rescue your people" ([[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
You may supply a verb for this phrase. AT: "and the light of your face obtained the land for their possession" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and the light of your face

contextId.information: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "and the places where they live will continue to all generations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and the places where they live, to all generations

contextId.information: The implied word "quiet" can be added to the translation. AT: "and quiet the commotion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The implied words can be added to the translation. AT: "or turned his covenant faithfulness away from me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: or his covenant faithfulness from me

contextId.information: The omitted information may be stated clearly. AT: "and as I declare your power to everyone who is to come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: your power to everyone who is to come

contextId.information: This can be stated with the understood information. AT: "I would rather be in your courts for one day than to be somewhere else for a thousand days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: For one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere

contextId.information: The words "the king" are understood. AT: "you have refused and rejected the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"he will judge the nations with fairness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The object may be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "it is pleasant to sing praises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
